## 판결문 요약


239 Minn. 214 (1953)
ELWOOD J. MARION AND ANOTHER
v.
ARTHUR R. MILLER AND ANOTHER.
VICTOR VIK, RELATOR.[1]
No. 36,080.
Supreme Court of Minnesota.
April 24, 1953.
*215 Sullivan, Stringer, Donnelly & Sharood and David R. Roberts, for relator.
Oppenheimer, Hodgson, Brown, Baer & Wolff, Edward L. Rogers, and Robert G. Renner, for respondents.
KNUTSON, JUSTICE.
On or about October 22, 1947, plaintiffs, who were then residents of Ohio, purchased from defendants Arthur R. Miller and Ruth F. Miller on a contract for deed a certain resort property in Cass county in this state. Thereafter, plaintiffs brought an action against defendants alleging fraud and deceit in the sale of the property and recovered a verdict of $20,402.50. On appeal, we affirmed. Marion v. Miller, 237 Minn. 306, 55 N.W. (2d) 52. Rehearing was denied on October 17, 1952. On October 28, 1952, at 10 a.m., plaintiffs entered and docketed judgment upon the verdict so obtained only to find that at 9:10 a.m. on the same day a quitclaim deed had been recorded with the register of deeds of Cass county wherein defendants Miller had conveyed the property involved to defendant Victor Vik.
Thereafter this action was commenced to set aside such deed as a fraudulent conveyance. The action was commenced in Cass county. Service was obtained on defendant Vik, who resides in Ramsey county.
